title: Medicare
shortDescription: Federal health insurance program for seniors and individuals with disabilities.
description: Medicare is the federal health insurance program primarily serving Americans 65 and older, but also covering younger individuals with certain disabilities. For autistic adults who qualify through disability, Medicare can cover diagnostic services, therapy, mental health treatment, and medical care. Coverage varies by Medicare plan type (Original Medicare, Medicare Advantage) and may require supplemental coverage for comprehensive benefits.
eligibility: Generally available to adults 65+, or younger adults receiving Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) for 24 months, or those with End-Stage Renal Disease or ALS. Autistic adults may qualify through disability pathways.
